title: Part A
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that no, Yanick would not be able to consume 2 units of Good A and 2 shirts and/or does not explain that his total expenditures would be $12 (=$2×2+$4×2) MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbbjxAHX garmWu51MyVXgaruWqVvNCPvMCG4uz3bqefqvATv2CG4uz3bIuV1wy Ubqee0evGueE0jxyaibaieYlf9irVeeu0dXdh9vqqj=hEeeu0xXdbb a9frFj0=OqFfea0dXdd9vqaq=JfrVkFHe9pgea0dXdar=Jb9hs0dXd bPYxe9vr0=vr0=vqpWqaaeaabiGaciaacaqabeaadaabauaaaOqaai aacIcacqGH9aqpcaGGKaGaaGOmaiabgEna0kaaikdacqGHRaWkcaGG KaGaaGinaiabgEna0kaaikdacaGGPaaaaa@43AA@ , which is greater than his weekly income of $10.

The response states that no Yanick would not be able to consume 2 units of Good A and 2 shirts and explains that his total expenditures would be $12 (=$2×2+$4×2) MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbbjxAHX garmWu51MyVXgaruWqVvNCPvMCG4uz3bqefqvATv2CG4uz3bIuV1wy Ubqee0evGueE0jxyaibaieYlf9irVeeu0dXdh9vqqj=hEeeu0xXdbb a9frFj0=OqFfea0dXdd9vqaq=JfrVkFHe9pgea0dXdar=Jb9hs0dXd bPYxe9vr0=vr0=vqpWqaaeaabiGaciaacaqabeaadaabauaaaOqaai aacIcacqGH9aqpcaGGKaGaaGOmaiabgEna0kaaikdacqGHRaWkcaGG KaGaaGinaiabgEna0kaaikdacaGGPaaaaa@43AA@ , which is greater than his weekly income of $10.

title: Part B
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not calculate the total consumer surplus as $122 and/or does not show the work.

Total Consumer Surplus = Total Benefit – Total Expenditures  = $128 – $6 = $122 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk 0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr 0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakqaabeqaaabaaaaaaa aapeGaaeivaiaab+gacaqG0bGaaeyyaiaabYgacaqGGaGaae4qaiaa b+gacaqGUbGaae4CaiaabwhacaqGTbGaaeyzaiaabkhacaqGGaGaae 4uaiaabwhacaqGYbGaaeiCaiaabYgacaqG1bGaae4CaiaabccacaqG 9aGaaeiiaiaabsfacaqGVbGaaeiDaiaabggacaqGSbGaaeiiaiaabk eacaqGLbGaaeOBaiaabwgacaqGMbGaaeyAaiaabshacaqGGaGaae4e GiaabccacaqGubGaae4BaiaabshacaqGHbGaaeiBaiaabccacaqGfb GaaeiEaiaabchacaqGLbGaaeOBaiaabsgacaqGPbGaaeiDaiaabwha caqGYbGaaeyzaiaabohacaqGGaaabaGaeyypa0Jaaeiiaiaacscaca aIXaGaaGOmaiaaiIdacaqGGaGaai4eGiaabccacaGGKaGaaGOnaiaa bccacqGH9aqpcaqGGaGaaiijaiaaigdacaaIYaGaaGOmaaaaaa@7A91@

title: Part C
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not identify that 3 units of Good A and 1 shirt will maximize Yanick’s total benefit given his weekly income of $10 and/or does not explain that for the last unit of each good consumed the ratio of the marginal benefit to the price of Good A (12) is equal to the ratio of the marginal benefit to the price of shirts (12), or

title: Part D
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does none of the following:

· States that the quantity of Good A that will maximize Yanick’s total benefit will decrease and explains that an increase in the number of consumers in the market for Good A will increase the demand for Good A, which will increase the price of Good A and decrease the marginal benefit per dollar spent that Yanick gets from each additional unit of the good.

· States that Yanick’s total consumer surplus would decrease and explains that an increase in the price of Good A would increase the total cost of consuming 3 units of Good A while the total benefit of consuming 3 units of Good A remains the same.

The response does one of the following:

· States that the quantity of Good A that will maximize Yanick’s total benefit will decrease and explains that an increase in the number of consumers in the market for Good A will increase the demand for Good A, which will increase the price of Good A and decrease the marginal benefit per dollar spent that Yanick gets from each additional unit of the good.

· States that Yanick’s total consumer surplus would decrease and explains that an increase in the price of Good A would increase the total cost of consuming 3 units of Good A while the total benefit of consuming 3 units of Good A remains the same.

The response does both of the following:

· States that the quantity of Good A that will maximize Yanick’s total benefit will decrease and explains that an increase in the number of consumers in the market for Good A will increase the demand for Good A, which will increase the price of Good A and decrease the marginal benefit per dollar spent that Yanick gets from each additional unit of the good.

· States that Yanick’s total consumer surplus would decrease and explains that an increase in the price of Good A would increase the total cost of consuming 3 units of Good A while the total benefit of consuming 3 units of Good A remains the same.
